Making people aware is important, but more important is to convert awareness into action. Clean India - Is attitude change more important than the movement

Yes, it is very important to create awareness in people. Cleaning india and keeping india clean is our prime minister`s moto. As we are the citizens of india our responsibility to keep our sorrounding clean and neat. We need to create a strong awareness in people sight. So, that they maintain cleanness in their homes and sorroundings. By conducting the awareness camps and railes we can aware people and protect them from deadful diseases. In many states they had been started cleaning programms and giving awareness in people by movement. As swach bharath is the cleanness programm started by our prime minister recently. 

  By taking the each individual cleaning responsibility so, that India become a very green and colorful country in the world. One should not throw their wastage on the roadsides must use the dustpins.They must feel as their duty to the growth of country.As the western countries people their strive to rule and regulations. In India we must to be follow some rule. Through the rules people may think of clean india and follow.The chief minister of hyderabad disturbed the dustpins for each household to keep India clean. They should take some more actions to keep india clean. Because of unclean ness in India there are so many people who are suffering from many kind of diseases. 

Each individual should proud of India and should keep Clean as their homes."cleaniness is the goddiness" if we clean the sorroundings is equal to serving the god. Attitude change is more important than the movement because the attitude will be changing the people`s mindset, their go forward to the movement of change in themself and the sorroundings.When attitude changes automatically the action has to be created in each idividuals. They would work for their country and feel proud of it. Swach bharath is the on going mission, each individual has to raise their hand to become succeed in their mission. The government should look care after the drainage and improperly built roads. They should provide public toilets on the roadside so people may not use the road as their toilets.
